member.name: DIRECTMANIPULATION_VIEWPORT_OPTIONS
member.summary: Defines the input behavior options for the viewport.

member.name: DIRECTMANIPULATION_VIEWPORT_OPTIONS.DIRECTMANIPULATION_VIEWPORT_OPTIONS_DEFAULT
member.summary: No special behaviors. This is the default value used to set or revert to default behavior.

member.name: DIRECTMANIPULATION_VIEWPORT_OPTIONS.DIRECTMANIPULATION_VIEWPORT_OPTIONS_AUTODISABLE
member.summary: At the end of an interaction, the viewport transitions to DIRECTMANIPULATION_READY and then immediately to DIRECTMANIPULATION_DISABLED. The viewport must be explicitly enabled through the Enable method before the next interaction can be processed.

member.name: DIRECTMANIPULATION_VIEWPORT_OPTIONS.DIRECTMANIPULATION_VIEWPORT_OPTIONS_MANUALUPDATE
member.summary: Update must be called to redraw the content within the viewport. The content is not updated automatically during an input event.

member.name: DIRECTMANIPULATION_VIEWPORT_OPTIONS.DIRECTMANIPULATION_VIEWPORT_OPTIONS_INPUT
member.summary: All input from a contact associated with the viewport is passed to the UI thread for processing.

summary.para: If set, all WM_POINTERDOWN messages are passed to the application for hit testing. Otherwise, Direct Manipulation will process the messages for hit testing against the existing list of running viewports, and the application will not see the input.
Applies only when viewport state is DIRECTMANIPULATION_RUNNING or DIRECTMANIPULATION_INERTIA.
Specifies that pixel snapping during a manipulation is disabled.

Anti-aliasing can create irregular edge rendering. Artifacts, commonly seen as blurry, or semi-transparent, edges can occur when the location of an edge falls in the middle of a device pixel rather than between device pixels.
